page.title: 08WARKWORTH HALL FARM PONDS.
page.content: TIT AND OPEN FRONTED NESTING BOXES HAVE BEEN PUT UP ON THE EMBANKMENTS AND BY THE FISH POND.IN FRONT OF THE FARM HOUSE THEY DUG A POND 10 FEET DEEP,TO CONNECT TO PART OF THE RAILWAY IN A CUTTING.THE SOIL WAS HEAPED UNDER A BRIDGE TO COMPLETE THE FORTH BANK OF THE POND.AGAIN RAIN WATER FILLED IT UP. APART FROM LILIES THE POND POPULATED ITSELF.A SIMPLE SOAK AWAY SYSTEM WAS INSTALLED TO PREVENT FLOODING. THE PONDS ATTRACT WILD DUCKS AND SWANS AND ARE A VERY ATTRACTIVE PART OF THE ENVIRONMENT.
